Topic.Title: Alibaba May Be Valued at $200 Billion by 2014 After IPO

Message.Msg: Add it up right.

Message.Title: Alibaba IPO only in USA?
Message.Msg: Chinese press is reporting that Jack Ma is #$%$-off with Chinese banks for not participating with the AG Mega loan. By his comments, he seem genuinely flabbergasted at why will the Chinese banks can not accept his dominance of China market and bend to his wishes (like USA's banks). I see a real opportunity of AG IPO only in US. My argument to him would be: "Ma, China incipient banking system can not understand nor is yet ready for the size of your vision. Soon they will be, let this fist IPO be in the USA and show them the way of how could be done." My target IPO valuation is $75B, so by years end Yahoo will have $7.2B in cash ($75Bx12%x80%tax).

Topic.Title: Alibaba IPO only in USA?

Message.Msg: In the other hand, if they do go into the Chinese market, they will announce the IPO date after the new Chinese IPO rules are final. The China Securities Regulatory Commission is preparing IPO reforms that would allow market forces, rather than regulators, to dictate the key terms of future listings. Consultation on the potential rule changes will end on June 21.

Message.Title: LightInTheBox could predict a $200B IPO price for Alibaba Group!
Message.Msg: Chinese company LightInTheBox IPO last week and has gained 46% since. Their P/E is negative, but EBITDA=$4.89M, Market cap is $831.27M, they have a Market Cap/EBITDA of 170. . IMAGINE Alibaba receiving the same ratio: $2B in 2013's EBITDA x 170 = $340B of market cap. and an IPO price of $233B!
